Posts.Content: sorry for all the questions ya´ll but if anyone give give estimates is great  a) how long after lumpectomy and centrall node biopsy do you start radio therapy b) if pathology comes back with no clear margin how long in general until surgery again if necessary. the army are asking for timescales and tried contacting the breast care team for last 3 days with no response or ring back  Thanks Claire x
Posts.Title: timescales

Posts.Content: thanks ladies, im still concidering telling surgeon i want mastecomy straight away as my breast wont take any more endless hacking that theyve had, am seeing consultant tuesday at my request as i wasnt given any options and if i do opt to have lumpectomy and they say further surgery they are getting rid of the lot,  so basically its waiting for results, waiting for whats next, wait wait wait, not good
Posts.Title: timescales

Posts.Content: I've had both knees replaced, I'm half way through chemo was fine with fec on day 4 of T and the severe pain in my joints is becoming unbearable if it doesn't calm down I'm actually thinking of telling the dr I don't want the next 2 treatments, I know T does affect the joints making them ache etc but wasn't expecting anything this bad xx
Posts.Title: Chemo effect on knee replacement

Posts.Content: Will have to wait till Monday now I suppose as its weekend
Posts.Title: problem with everything

Posts.Content: Ok finished chemo and radio now, might have to ask if can switch to something else bar tamoxifen if I can as have severe nerve problems in my feet and the tablets for it don't work,  I have now got painful cysts appear under arm of side I didn't get surgery on ,  Also still waiting for follow up with breast clinic as haven't seen that doc since second surgery in September
Posts.Title: problem with everything

Posts.Content: my worry is my auntie died of breast cancer at my age, She was one of the ones in the Stoke scandals few years back where they received the wrong doses of radiotherapy, i was diagnosed 9 days ago , i can understand where your coming from with your fear x
Posts.Title: frightened of dying at same age as my mother

Posts.Content: good luck to you, which hospital or area you in Snowys Mum x

Posts.Title: understanding letter received by GP

Posts.Content: It doesn't say positive or negative just awaiting results as its hiding behind scar tissue from last surgery they estimated the size from what they could see it's all just becoming real now and doesn't help my husband is overseas with the army and he isn't allowed home
Posts.Title: understanding letter received by GP

Posts.Content: Hi all,  you all know but story, anyway got a copy of letter sent to GP from the consultant after diagnosed last friday, lots in there he never told me, he didnt even grade me or anything when i saw him just he is sure the caught it early, which seam as though he was sure it was scar tissue and wasnt  anyway this in a nut shell  grade 2 invasive ductal carcinoma 10mm ER8 HER2 having lumpectomy and sentinel node removed 18th, letter says may need chemo, he never said that one, i know about the radio therapy and tamoxifen, chance of further surgery,  i have appt with him tuesday as with my history my GP concurs i should discuss mastectomy option
Posts.Title: understanding letter received by GP

Posts.Content: THANKS ALL I think the anger is still there that until surgery it won´t hit me properly, its the waiting game after surgery i´m not looking forward to  x
Posts.Title: understanding letter received by GP

Posts.Title: critical illness insurance

Posts.Content: anyone else had a problem with theres, 3 years ago i couldnt claim cause the cancer was non evasive, now its grade 2 invasive but i cant claim cause i´ve had breast surgery for cancer in the past, also i never informed them i went to the doctors cause i had swelling in my legs. what swelling in legs has to do with fucking breast cancer is beyond me sorry for the rant,  worried now about getting into debt
